pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.1: When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.2: She commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.3: when she consents to him taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.4: when she consents to him taking hold of her above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.5: when she consents to him taking hold of something connected to her body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.2: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.3: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.4: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.5: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.6: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.7: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.8: They are found in three classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.9: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.11: from body and mind, not from speech.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.12: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.13: They are settled through three principles:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.14: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.1: When asking for curd and then eating it, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.2: She commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.3: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.4: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.2: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.3: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.4: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.5: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.6: They belong to one kind of failure:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.8: They are found in two classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.9: they may be in the class of offenses entailing acknowledgment; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.11: from body, not from speech or mind; or
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.12: from body and speech, not from mind; or
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.13: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.15: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.16: They are settled through three principles:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.17: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:5.1: The gathering up section, the eighth, is finished.
